column2: Skeletal and cardiac muscle derived from paraxial mesoderm
column3: Bone and connective tissue derived from mesenchyme
column4: Notochord acting as a mesodermal signaling structure
column5: Central and peripheral nervous system derived from germ layers
column7:
Question
Mesoderm differentiates into all EXCEPT:

Correct answer: D — Nervous system

Core idea (exam focus)
Each germ layer gives rise to specific tissue systems.

Mechanism / reasoning
  • Mesoderm forms muscle, bone, connective tissue, blood, notochord, cardiovascular and urogenital systems.
  • Nervous system derives from ectoderm (neural tube and neural crest).

Why the other options are not
  • A: Muscle is mesodermal.
  • B: Bone and connective tissue are mesodermal.
  • C: Notochord is a mesodermal structure.

Exam gold (high-yield)
Mesoderm = muscle, bone, blood

column1: Which of the following is NOT included in the glycocalyx?
column3: Glycoproteins forming the cell surface coat
column4: Glycolipids exposed on the outer membrane leaflet
column5: Steroid molecules embedded within the membrane
column7:
Question
Which of the following is NOT included in the glycocalyx?

Correct answer: D — Steroid molecules

Core idea (exam focus)
The glycocalyx is a carbohydrate-rich surface layer.

Mechanism / reasoning
  • Glycocalyx consists of carbohydrate chains of glycoproteins, proteoglycans, and glycolipids.
  • Steroids are lipid molecules, not carbohydrate components.

Why the other options are not
  • A–C: All contribute carbohydrate chains to the glycocalyx.

Exam gold (high-yield)
Think “glyco = sugar,” not lipid hormones.

column2: They are composed of actin filaments arranged in helices
column3: They consist of keratin protein subunits
column4: They form a hollow cylinder of 13 protofilaments
column5: They anchor intermediate filaments to desmosomes
column7:
Question
Microtubules — which statement is TRUE?

Correct answer: C — 13 protofilaments

Core idea (exam focus)
Structural organization of cytoskeletal elements.

Mechanism / reasoning
  • Microtubules are polymers of α- and β-tubulin.
  • They form hollow tubes composed of 13 protofilaments.

Why the other options are not
  • A: Actin forms microfilaments.
  • B: Keratin forms intermediate filaments.
  • D: Desmosomes link intermediate filaments.

Exam gold (high-yield)
13 protofilaments = microtubules.

column1: Which cell junction is NOT associated with the cytoskeleton?
column4: Hemidesmosomes anchoring cells to basal lamina
column7:
Question
Which cell junction is NOT associated with the cytoskeleton?

Correct answer: D — Gap junctions

Core idea (exam focus)
Functional classification of cell junctions.

Mechanism / reasoning
  • Gap junctions consist of connexons for communication.
  • They do not provide mechanical cytoskeletal anchorage.

Why the other options are not
  • A–C: All are structurally linked to cytoskeletal elements.

Exam gold (high-yield)
Gap junctions = communication, not structure.

column1: Optimal pH of lysosomal enzymes is:
column7:
Question
Optimal pH of lysosomal enzymes is:

Correct answer: C — pH 5.0

Core idea (exam focus)
Functional environment of intracellular organelles.

Mechanism / reasoning
  • Lysosomes contain acid hydrolases.
  • Low pH is maintained by proton pumps.

Why the other options are not
  • A, B: Would inactivate lysosomal enzymes.
  • D: pH is tightly regulated.

Exam gold (high-yield)
Lysosome = acidic digestion.

column1: The middle segment of a chromosome is called the:
column7:
Question
The middle segment of a chromosome is called the:

Correct answer: C — Centromere

Core idea (exam focus)
Chromosome structural terminology.

Mechanism / reasoning
  • The centromere connects sister chromatids.
  • It serves as the attachment site for spindle fibers.

Why the other options are not
  • A: Telomeres are terminal ends.
  • B: Kinetochore is a protein complex on the centromere.
  • D: Chromatid is a structural unit.

Exam gold (high-yield)
Centromere = middle + spindle attachment.

column1: Which organelle is NOT part of the secretory pathway?
column7:
Question
Which organelle is NOT part of the secretory pathway?

Correct answer: D — Peroxisomes

Core idea (exam focus)
Protein trafficking pathways.

Mechanism / reasoning
  • Secretory pathway: RER → Golgi → vesicles.
  • Peroxisomes are autonomous metabolic organelles.

Why the other options are not
  • A–C: Directly involved in protein secretion.

Exam gold (high-yield)
Peroxisomes ≠ secretion.

column1: Intermediate filaments are primarily responsible for:
column7:
Question
Intermediate filaments are primarily responsible for:

Correct answer: C — Structural stability

Core idea (exam focus)
Functional roles of cytoskeletal components.

Mechanism / reasoning
  • Intermediate filaments resist mechanical stress.
  • They anchor cells at junctions.

Why the other options are not
  • A: Microtubules handle transport.
  • B: Actin mediates contraction.
  • D: Mitochondria synthesize ATP.

Exam gold (high-yield)
Intermediate filaments = strength.

column1: Which germ layer gives rise to the nervous system?
column7:
Question
Which germ layer gives rise to the nervous system?

Correct answer: C — Ectoderm

Core idea (exam focus)
Germ layer derivatives.

Mechanism / reasoning
  • Ectoderm forms neural tube and neural crest.

Why the other options are not
  • A: Mesoderm forms muscle and bone.
  • B: Endoderm forms gut epithelium.
  • D: Extraembryonic structures only.

Exam gold (high-yield)
Ecto = neural.
